If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view.

In your opinion, what are the most important things students should learn in school? What is the most important thing you have learned in school? How has this knowledge affected your life? How do you think it will help your success in the future?

---

In my opinion, the most important thing students should learn in school is how to interact with other people. I think that this is the most important thing because it will help them in their future. If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view.

In my opinion, the most important thing students should learn in school is how to interact with other people. I think that this is the most important thing because it will help them in their future. If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

In my opinion, the most important thing students should learn in school is how to interact with other people. I think that this is the most important thing because it will help them in their future. If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?

I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

In my opinion, the most important thing students should learn in school is how to interact with other people. I think that this is the most important thing because it will help them in their future. If they can learn how to interact with other people, they will be able to get along with them. They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?

They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many were caused by a how many of these could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school is how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

As long as I am able to communicate with others, I will have a good life in the future. These skills are the most important thing I learned in school,  and are key to my success in life.

 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. ow has this knowledge affected my life?

They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many were caused by a breakdown in communication-how many problems could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school ,ior s how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

As long as I am able to communicate with others, I will have a good life in the future. These skills are the most important thing I learned in school,  and are key to my success in life.

They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many were caused by a breakdown in communication-how many problems could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
I think that the most important thing I have learned in school ,ior life i s how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

As long as I am able to communicate with others, I will have a good life in the future. These skills are the most important thing I learned in school,  and are key to my success in life.

In my opinion, the most important thing students should learn in school is how to interact with other people. I think that this is the most important thing because it will help them in their future. If children can learn how to interact effectively with other people, they will be able to get along with them. 

They will be able to get along with their friends and their family. They will be able to get along with their teachers and their bosses. They will be able to get along with their coworkers. They will be able to get along with their neighbors. They will be able to get along with the people they meet. 

Most of life is dealing with other people. We have interactions with people every day, and during our formative years, if we learn to make the interactions smooth, we will have an easy life. If we don't, we will have a hard life. Think of most negative actions. Murder, war, divorce, famine-how many were caused by a breakdown in communication-how many problems could we solve with better communication and empathy? 
IBy Te most important thing I have learned in school ,ior life in general s how to communicate with other people.
 I had a teacher who genuinely cared about her students, and emphasized really listening to each other. She taught us how to listen to each other, and how to speak in a way that would be heard. She taught us how to be respectful of each other, and how to be honest with each other. She taught us how to be empathetic towards each other, and how to be kind to each other. She taught us how to be good friends, and how to be good family members.

ow has this knowledge affected my life?
 It has made my life much better. I have learned how to communicate with other people, and I have learned how to listen to them. I avoided many problems that would have happened, had I not truly been listening. I avoided hurting people by asking myself how they would feel.   I avoided many fights by listening to what the other person was saying, and trying to understand their point of view. 

This empathetic perspective, and ability to communicate with others has served me well. I have a good job, and I am happy.  I have good friends, and I have a good family. I have a good life, and I owe it to my ability to communicate with other people.

As long as I am able to communicate with others, I will have a good life in the future. These skills are the most important thing I learned in school,  and are key to my success in life.
